website_summaries.verdict: The Photosmart Premium is a nifty little multifunction with the added novelty of a touchscreen. It does a great job of plain text, but it's a pity about its colour prints.

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer - but buy extra ink
customer_reviews.text: This is a good overall printer that is versitile and produces good prints. But... As others have pointed out, it goes through ink cartridges quickly. This printer has the advantage that it uses multiple ink cartridges. if you run out of one color, you don't have to replace them all. But, this also produces the perception that it is always about to run out of some color. So, Buy backup cartridges and have them ready. This printer requires FIVE cartridges. Which are generally purchased as three seperate retail packages: * Black 564, * Photo Black 564 * Cyan-Magenta-Yellow combo pack 564. So you should have backups of all of those items.
customer_reviews.author: T. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Bad support
customer_reviews.text: I needed a printer and decided to get this HP photosmart wireless printer. The first problem appears with ink cartridge installation. When trying to calibrate, the machine completely failed. I have moved back and forth the cartridges without success. There is poor support from HP regarding how to fix the issues or what could cause the issues. My friend advices me this problem comes the cartridge and I should request new ones directly to HP. The communication between my PC and the printer was done easily with the provided CD, but when trying to do the upgrade through HP software everything got lost...
customer_reviews.author: bolo591

customer_reviews.title: Works most of the time
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine printer when it works (about 80% of the time). The problem I have with this is regards to the wireless connection. Since the purchase (about a year ago), the biggest problem we have is wit the drivers. Every month or so, the drivers are out of date and have to re-install. Now, let me talk about the good in this. When it works, this printer really does a whole bunch of things and it does it well. I never had any problem scanning documents or pictures. The print out quality is excellent and crisp. If it wasn't for the connectivity issue I would give this a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: sd754

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is by far, the worst printer I've ever owned. I've had several HP printer so when I was looking for a wireless network printer, I selected HP. This printer has problems with paper feed and ink usage. It will feed several sheets of paper at one time. Sometimes the ink will just squirt out causing a big "blob" on the page. It wastes a lot of ink and expensive photo paper. The wireless network was very easy to setup but after many hours of effort, I still am unable to get the bluetooth printing to work. It just says the device is paired but not connected. Nothing I try can get it to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this printer
customer_reviews.text: I liked the sellers willingness to ship to meet my schedule.I liked that the product worked as he stated and that he let me know in the ad that print drivers were needed.Very happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As Easy as it Gets
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer for the wireless features and was pleasantly impressed by the long list of "ease of use" items. For example, to scan a document, one merely needs to use the touch screen on the printer to make simple selections and next thing you know your image is saved to your computer (or a number of other options). It doesn't get any easier. Quality is good for a home user as is the speed. Since it has a sleep mode, I just leave the thing on which saves energy as compared to my habits of use for the former printer I had. Two thumbs up for HP.
customer_reviews.author: ShawnInPaso

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Photosmart 1215 printer that I thought was really good, but this printer "smokes" that one in quality and speed. The photos are just fabulous and photo reproduction using the scanner to "blow-up" a picture is just incredible. Had one startup problem: 2 installled programs would not print results and a call to Hewlett Packard solved the problem. They installed another printer driver for those programs and everthing OK. I would recommend this all-in-one for anyone who appreciates great quality photos. Although I haven't purchased print cartridges yet, the concept of individual cartridges surely will reduce my printing costs by purchasing only the colors I need.
customer_reviews.author: Scottie

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart Premium printer
customer_reviews.text: After a bad experience with the purchase of another, new HP printer about 6 months ago (I ended up sending the printer back), I was concerned to set up this HP Photosmart printer. To my surprise, it was a smooth and trouble-free experience. The software loaded w/o a hitch, all the instructions were easy to follow and the printer performed as promised. Printing, scanning and copying are all easy and of superior quality. I do not have any experience with cartridge life yet, but so far I love this printer
customer_reviews.author: Fred Majewski

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer. It works flawlessly, I'm able to have my hard-wired network computers tied-in, my wireless computers tied it and even the phones able to either BT or wi-fi print to it. Yes, it is a little noisy -- but so is the far more expensive laser printer on my desk. You get used to the noise and if nothing else, you are certainly tipped-off when printing is about to occur. We like this so much, that other family member now also have one. So this actually receives multiple thumbs-up!
customer_reviews.author: Lj Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Absolute INK HOG
customer_reviews.text: This printer is terrible. I bought a new pack of the ink set to print labels. I printed 10 pages...yes 10 pages of Avery 2 x 3 inch labels with two words and two clip art pics on each label. I am out of ink. I had to stop using the Wi-Fi because it would stop working and wouldn't reinstall. I apparently can't clean the scanner enough so that pictures I scan don't have speckles all over the pictures. The only think it does well is copy and scan in black and white.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie S

customer_reviews.title: Simple, yet affordable and fast printing
customer_reviews.text: The HP Photosmart Premium printer was easy to set-up. The print and photo quality is excellent. It's nice having the touch screen versus a bunch of different buttons. It's compact and prints much faster than my previous HP 6300 printer. I did have some problems setting up the wireless mode. Apparently, if you try to do the wireless setup, then the wired mode is disabled which, I didn't want since it's set-up on a LAN. I hope read the instructions right. Overall, an excellent printer for the price and features.
customer_reviews.author: Mariano M. Jauco

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: Good printer but that's what you would expect from HP the biggest complaint I have about HP printers is the price of the ink and small amount of printing they do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Fine All-in-One
customer_reviews.text: This model is also identified by HP as model C309g. Although I bought it primarily to be a copier, I quickly discovered it's an excellent photo printer, much better than my HP photosmart 7960. The only negative aspect I've seen is that yellow is a bit too strong, making greens appear a bit off-color. I recommend using 564XL ink cartridges instead of the regular 564. Be wary of the "low ink" warnings, as there may be significant ink remaining in the identified cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: NICE PRINTER BUT SOME BUGS
customer_reviews.text: Quality of print jobs and speed of printing are excellent. However, using the wireless interface my computer could not locate the printer and I had to reinstall the software three times to get it to work. Also, HP brags about their ink lasting longer than other manufacturers. I found that this is not true as I had to buy a new black ink cartridge after just 40 pages. Not a bad printer for low end home use, but the cost of replacement ink could make other printers a better buy.
customer_reviews.author: Bill N.J.

customer_reviews.title: Works for three months!
customer_reviews.text: This printer was great for three months! Then I got an ink failure notice which began on Feb. 24 on March 13th I picked up the third replacement and that did not work and so I asked for a refund. I am awaiting the results. My sense is that they will pro-rate the refund. I asked for a full refund. The HP tech support people were pretty great, but they can't make a printer that works! All three replacements were defective. I would never purchase an HP product again! I'm trying Canon this time.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Janes-brown

customer_reviews.title: good printer
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer about 2 weeks. The quality of the print is very good, have scanned pictures and they came out where I was very happy with them. I like the front loading of the paper and the on and off button is very handy to get to right in the front. It also prints very fast. I wish more information was printed in the brochure as only about 6 pages covers any informatiion at all of which everything else is online. I would recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Donna .

customer_reviews.title: Quality and service
customer_reviews.text: The printer has not functioned at all for about a month. The screen shows " Alignment Failed", and I have followed all of the procedures recommended. The last E-mail from them instructed me to perform a procedure that I could not achieve the first step. They said that it was probably a mechanical problem, and that an expert would call within a specific time range.Well, no one called, so I am asking for a replacement. If I am successful , I will make an addendum to my review.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph H. Larson

customer_reviews.title: HP Wireless Printer Pretty Nice
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this printer to replace an 8 year old wired HP printer. So far so good in limited use. Wireless setup was pretty easy and so far no problems printing wirelessly. I wish I would have paid closer attention to compatibility though because I have an Ipad & Iphone and this printer does not work with Airprint which is what is needed to print using an Apple device-HP makes a very similiar printer that is also Airprint compatible if you will use it for that.
customer_reviews.author: Sequoia

customer_reviews.title: HP PremPrinter
customer_reviews.text: At the price point the utility of this printer is excellent. In addition,the cost of the ink is lower than the printer I replaced. I actually replace two printers with this one. The wireless connection did not work and I didn't take the time to troubleshoot it although I'm sure it's doable. The printer sync'd with the Linksys wireless router but I couldn't get the computer to agree (WINXP SP3). I would recommend this printer without qualification
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Just didn't work
customer_reviews.text: You really don't want to know what I think of this particular model. I spent 12 hours total with HP and finally decided it just wasn't going to work. We sent it back. We did however purchase an HP photosmart 7520 and after spending 2 hrs with HP it did work. We purchased this one from Office Depot.....
customer_reviews.author: BJ's Mailbox

customer_reviews.title: HP Printer / Copier Problems
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a new HP Photosmart Premium printer/copier several months ago. My old HP printer and HP copier had provided excellent service for many years, but they had finally started making funny noises and were starting to be undependable. This new HP Photosmart Premium printer/scanner is difficult to operate, slow, noisy, gulps ink and comes with software that is not nearly as user friendly as the HP printer software of the mid 1990's. My old HP printer provided excellent service for many years. I am frustrated that I purchased a new HP scanner/printer that does not provide any better copies than the old ones, but has the many disadvantages listed above.
customer_reviews.author: K. Michael Foos

customer_reviews.title: Great printer but doesn't work with iPad
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer in hopes of it working with the iPad, and yes I know it wasn't on the "official" list. But it was on sale and it was a good printer so we thought we would give it a try. We ended up returning it. Overall the printer was GREAT. Fast printing, easy to use interface and touchscreen. Good quality prints, easy to setup and I really liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan G

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This does everything I need and then some. If you are not computer/printer/wireless literate, get some help, but even those with little to no experience should be able to set this up and use it. I have it on my home network and it took about an hour to set it up and connect all 3 of my computers. It scans, prints and copies just like a professional printer. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Sid Gurney

customer_reviews.title: AVOID!
customer_reviews.text: Awful printer! Died after 6 months! Had to replace the ink 3 times to boot with VERY minimal use. Went back to Epson 9 months ago and haven't replaced the ink yet. Come on HP!! You can do better!
customer_reviews.author: MtnGirl

customer_reviews.title: Definately right choice!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this printer from Amazon. Crazy price! It arrived in a day (thanks, Amazon :) Slick set up! Love the Bluetooth and wireless. Only hiccup was setting up to print from another computer on different part of network separated by range extender - it worked itself out. I love the separate color print cartridges and can see the savings right away. I can't believe how great this P/S/C is for the price. I might just buy another one just for the heck of it. DON'T HESITATE! I am a Computer specialist and know what I'm talking about - not a newbie.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Borden

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Print speed is fine, but terribly loud and slow to start up and it loses internet connection too often. After about a year or two, it rarely finds a connection and keeps it, so we have to plug it in to the laptop. Print quality is fine, but runs out of ink far too quickly. Too old of a model for anyone to buy now anyway,
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart printer is excellent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer for my wife and it worked well. When she didn't need it any longer I gave it to my daughter and it now has a second live. It is used all the time and the wireless connection makes it a very flexible for printing from a laptop in another room. it uses ink sparingly and has good quality output
customer_reviews.author: CHTX

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: I have had many printers but I have finally found the one that is best for me. The quality of picture printing far exceeds my expectations. I am able to print from anywhere in my house and back yard and from any of our computers. The price of ink is very affordable. If you are looking for a great wireless print HP Photosmart Premium all-in-one is for you
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Amaral

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this printer. It takes 20+ minutes to print one full color sheet if it decides to print at all. Frequent error messages and paper jams. It's loud. It drinks printer ink like a fish. I've never been so disappointed with a product as I am with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Katiedid

customer_reviews.title: I wait till the ink completely runs out to replace and find it locally at a better price. No problem
customer_reviews.text: Still using it after all these years. I wait till the ink completely runs out to replace and find it locally at a better price. No problem.
customer_reviews.author: Inez

customer_reviews.title: HP printer quality bad
customer_reviews.text: Have never been so disgusted with a piece of equipment as this printer.. Drinks ink like a drunken sailor drinks beer, and, after a few months it quit working.. HP is out to sell ink, that's why their printers are cheap.. Never again HP,,
customer_reviews.author: Texas Girl

customer_reviews.title: I really like this printer
customer_reviews.text: I wirelessly connected this to a laptop running windows 7. The installation was not a problem. I have had no recognition problems since. It does take about a minute to warm up but so what? The printing looks great and is faster than anything else I've used. I continue to buy HP products and I continue to be pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Stoddard

customer_reviews.title: Hit the Mark-Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Very easy set up. Needed to try a couple of times to get wireless connected, but still relatively easy, especially when compared to other printers I have had in the past. Quality very good. Use for personal and business (photos, docs, scanning, etc). Bit noisy, but not enough to outweigh the pros. Good buy, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: HP Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have my for over 4 year, love it, had some software issues recently, uninstalled all the HP software and reinstalled the CD installation and problem was solved. My printer only cost $99.00 back then. That was a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Viking Starr

customer_reviews.title: HP Printers are worthless!
customer_reviews.text: I have only purchased HP printers and have had excellent luck untill the last 4 years. I do not know what HP has done to itself to put out such non-working garbage. The first all in one simply stopped working, the second the scanner burned up and the most recent works when it wants to, but usually just spits your paper back at you! I am not sure what type of printer I will buy next, but I will NEVER purchase another worthless HP product!
customer_reviews.author: jan

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This printer lasted only one year and was very expensive to operate.
customer_reviews.author: N. Allen

customer_reviews.title: It prints just fine, and produces good clear scans
customer_reviews.text: In several years of use, it has performed well. It prints just fine, and produces good clear scans. Like all printers of its ilk, it drinks ink...even when you are not printing. I leave it on constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Neil G.

customer_reviews.title: My similar all-in-one Epson works a lot better.
customer_reviews.text: The cartridges dry within a couple of months, so you just keep needing to buy new ones. My similar all-in-one Epson works a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Rosenbaum

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart Premium
customer_reviews.text: The ease of purchase and delivery was excellent. the problems were with the installation and making the printer work. I have an iMac and needed to download the software rather than use the accompanying CD. Downloading had NO instructions, and it was necessary to call HP for assistance. Almost two hours was wasted while attempting to install the software! EVERY ONE of the cartridges leaked when installing. Once I installed problem free cartridges, the printer didn't work. I had to call again for assistance in downloading software - another two hours!!! I nearly sent the printer back, but finally, after several tries to make it work, it is now working as it should.
customer_reviews.author: jr

customer_reviews.title: HP Photoprinter
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product; excellent price; superb and fast shipment. However, the OEM box (packed well) was placed in a larger Amazon box, but had no fill placed in it. The OEM box was not stationary; also, part of the single shipping tape was broken. Recommend Amazon improve shipment container packing.
customer_reviews.author: Computer User

customer_reviews.title: All In One!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is the best!!! I can print photos; envelopes; letters or information, and can scan. This printer has so many features, it's "All-In-One". The Ink Cartridges that it uses lasts a long time. I'm glad my husband helped me find this one and we got rid of the old printer!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Amazon put this back on my list of reviews. Bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon put this back on my list of reviews. Bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: John Davis

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart Premium Wireless All-in-One Printer
customer_reviews.text: So far (1 month), I love it. Easy to assemble, hook up and connect. Love the wireless feature. Quality is outstanding, as is ease of use. It's noisy, but what inkjet printer isn't? Totally satisfied at this early stage. Scan/copy quality is much better than I've experienced with previous printers I've owned. Costwise, a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: M. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: great printer -- so far
customer_reviews.text: Reviewed many aio printers from HP and finally settled on this one. I received it much faster than I thought and when I installed it everything went very smoothly. I appreciate this because I am a novice and did not want to ask for help on installing it. Very happy with the print, scan & copy that I have used so far. Wireless install was very easy with my PC...now I still need to install the software on my Dell mini and hope everything goes as smoothly with that.... Price was great -- purchasing was easy with very fast delivery (2 days). I would definitely recommend this to a friend or purchase it again myself.
customer_reviews.author: Nan Man

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer! I use it for home use. People have complained about the grinding noise. It does make a grinding sound after it prints, but I believe that is to realign the printing heads and/or ink. Otherwise, it's great! I love the wireless! And it's so easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: realmary

customer_reviews.title: hps best printer!
customer_reviews.text: The printer says what It does and does what it says! I would highly recommend this printer especially - the photosmart premium print good quality pictures and the scanner is a nice feature. It also comes with a good amount of ink to start you off with not half filled.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer approx. 4 weeks ago. It is a great printer and does quality paper and photo prints. The only problem Is the time it takesfor the printer to recalibrate between prints, it goes through a series of gyrations that takes several seconds.
customer_reviews.author: jowarren

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great printer so far. It's so different from my old printer that it takes me a while to figure out a new and different print job, but the quality of the printing has been terrific. I'm a little sad because I'm already getting a notice that my ink level is low and I haven't printed a lot of copies, but I think I remember reading that the original cartridges aren't high capacity... Over all, I'm very pleased with the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart Premium All-in-One worst HP printer
customer_reviews.text: I owned many HP printers but this is by far the worst printer by any manufacturer I have ever owned. I used the wireless feature.....printer takes forever to start once the print command is given. Often it would indicate that the print failed or printer was offline and then a minute later print the document. I had to reinstall several times to continue to use the wireless feature. Today, not only did the wireless feature fail to reinstall but when I tried to hookup using USB, it still wouldn't work. I am done with HP!
customer_reviews.author: LindaH

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart Premium Printer
customer_reviews.text: The HP Photosmart Premium Printer works great. Installation went smoothly and the print quality is very good. The only thing the instructions weren't real clear on was setting up to print both Wireless and Blu-Tooth. I had to set the printer twice as two seperate printers (one for wireless and one for Blu-Tooth) and then select the printer for how I was currently printing.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Allen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer a couple of weeks ago, and have been very happy with it. It was easy to setup, easy to configure with my wireless network (Apple Time Capsule) and prints great quality pictures. I purchased this to replace an old photo scanner and old HP Photo printer that was really slow. This printer if fast and I really like the integrated photo tray.
customer_reviews.author: K. Basore

customer_reviews.title: Can't afford the ink
customer_reviews.text: After printing only 25 4x6 pictures, it wanted new ink. I figured it was shipped with bad ones, so I ordered a very expensive new set. The set lasted until 65 prints. I called HP and they sent a new printer out. The new ink in that printer lasted for 25 pics. This will be my last HP purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nana of two

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: It's a really good printer. easy to set up and use. The touchscreen interface is good and even has a help function to assist in setting it up. It was really easy to connect all the laptops in the household to it wirelessly. I also like how you can insert removable hard drives (USB drives, Sd cards) to download scans into them. It helps to keep images secure.
customer_reviews.author: vevee04

customer_reviews.title: Will never buy HP again
customer_reviews.text: Never again..ink does not last...expensive to refill, HP doesnt like if you dont use their cartridges....wireless won't work, hard to make pictures. I just use for black and white printer and scan.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I don't often review items, but having such bad luck with printers these past years I felt the need to rave about HP C309. Unlike the Brother I bought 6 months ago, and ended up tossing in the trash due its many break downs, and it's cheap!! construction, The C309 is built like a tank. Quality construction I've only on business printers. The touch screen uses large lettering where those of use with aging eyes can easily see all that going on. It is well worth money.
customer_reviews.author: T. R. Dent

customer_reviews.title: Very, very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Great printer for the price. Easy to set up, easy to use. I've not had it long, so reliability is still an assumption, but at this point I'm very, very happy. Would definitely recommend. Great photos as well as documents.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rittenberg

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Wireless Printer
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe how easy it was to set-up this printer. It was as easy as, plug in, turn it on and WHAM it basically set itself up. Great printing of text and graphics. The photo's are great. This is a no brainer....
customer_reviews.author: GBurke

customer_reviews.title: Print and copy quality is terrible
customer_reviews.text: The print quality is very poor. Differing parts of a document being printed will be faded or look as if they are in italics. The printer just does not copy. It gives the user a faded copy that may have 10% of the image and is totally unusable. I've done everything suggested to fix the problem, including replacing the print cartridges at a cost of $120. I would not recommend purchasing this machine if you intend to use it for anything other than photos. I'm going to replace it with another manufacturer's product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hiatt

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is just plain great. It was easy to set up and network and it prints fast high quality images and documents with a really neat touch screen interface and for the price (it's a steal) you just can't go wrong with this beauty.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer replaces an earlier version which finally stopped loading efficiently. It is an excellent machine.
customer_reviews.author: kaiapit

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart Premium All in One
customer_reviews.text: Great printer especially for the money. Set up was easy for all but the most computer illiterate. They choice of wireless, WiFi or ethernet was both welcome and easy to set up. We have only used a few days but have printed both documents and photos. The documents are fast and clear. The photo was awesome. Ink consumption remains to be seen. The onscreen menu is truly idiot proof. I havent tried the scanner or copier yet.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: looks good on paper but in reality not very good
customer_reviews.text: finicky wireless connection, will recognize some but not all laptops sucks up toner, very expensive to maintain, and as soon as you put in a new cartridge HP starts giving you messages that you need to think about replacing the toner again terrible printing speeds, each time before it prints it has to go through a checking routine which in itself is frustrating to have to wait on I use to be an HP fan but for the past few years their products seem to leave very much to be desired
customer_reviews.author: Randi Houts

customer_reviews.title: Awesome All-in-one
customer_reviews.text: This printer is top notch for the money, have only had for a month but photo quality is nice and ease of use is amazing. Really like the 4x6 tray also, the printing quality on regular prints is great.- Only neg is there is lots of printer head movement(a little noisy).
customer_reviews.author: koda5115

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart Premium purchased at Amazon.com
customer_reviews.text: Great item! Serves its purpose, does everything its suppose to do! Print...Scan....Copy! Super fast printing! I'm on one side of my living room and the printer is on the other side all I do is click print and the magic happens no wires! The only complaint i might have is when i print a photo the quality is not 100%, its maybe 90% perfect not sure though if its the camera taking poor photos, that is the only reason I gave this printer a 4. Other than that the printer is AWESOME! I am very please with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Works Well great price
customer_reviews.text: Great price/deal for it being Bluetooth and Wifi enabled. Prints very well and very fast even including 4x6 photos! Used CD and very easy to install. Newer drivers on the website as well.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Grasso

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the older one when HP refused to write a driver for Windows 7. Although I am NOT impressed with HP's "forced" upgrade policy, I really do like this printer. Much easier to use than the old 1250 the wireless feature is great.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, but it prints, like, 3 things before needing more ink. I mainly use the scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Siren

customer_reviews.title: Even a non-techie loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Needed something my non-technical wife could use for scrap booking/photo printing -- this was it! I have needed to provide her little to no assistance - including changing the ink! As long as the XL version of ink is bought - ink usage/replacement is reasonable. Good quality output - but we don't use it for any professional purposes (home use only).
customer_reviews.author: Trying Things

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a while then started having trouble with paper feed
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Fowler

customer_reviews.title: A great printer
customer_reviews.text: Installing the software was a bit of the pain first time installing there was an error the second time was the charm. Setting up the wireless was a pain trying to connect to the router box but once connected everything worked smoothly. It prints and scans Wireless at a fast speed.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: I love it, but it could use less ink
customer_reviews.text: I love it, but it could use less ink. Couldn't they all? The scanner works very well. I've had worse.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Ink Guzzler
customer_reviews.text: This machine with the "Touch-Screen" feature is very easy to use and delivers high-quality copies and scans, but goes through ink quickly, and the cartridges cost a lot. I wish they made a larger size cartridge, especially for the black ink. There is a separate tray for 4" x 6" photos, which I really like. All in all, it is a classy all-in-one product that works well with my HP laptop.
customer_reviews.author: John Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Printer!
customer_reviews.text: This is the easiest printer to install that I have ever owned. The instructions were very clear and straightforward. The printer is fast and the print quality is excellent, especially the photographs. The only "down side" (if you can even call it that) is it can be a bit noisy, especially during startup. However, it is a fair tradeoff for the speed and quality of the printing. I heartily recommend this all-in-one printer!
customer_reviews.author: Slow Joe

customer_reviews.title: HP FINALLY DID IT RIGHT
customer_reviews.text: All I HAVE TO SAY ABOUT HP PHOTOSMART PRINTER IS THAT HP FINALLY DID IT RIGHT. EASY TO SET UP EASY TO USE PRINTS GREAT. ITS QUIET AND LOOKS REALLY NICE. I CANT FIND ANYTHING WRONG EXCEPT I DONT LIKE HAVING TO BUY 5 INK CARTDRIGES.
customer_reviews.author: J. fagin

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Returned, it did not work. They very willingly refunded my purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: LuAnn

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. The pictures are so clear and beautiful. I don't really think the ink is used any more then it was on the cheap printers. But the quality of the picture is 10 times better then the other printers I have had.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ottinger

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: i have always purchased hp products not only was this a great buy but i am very pleased with the quality printing that it does i work alot with photo's and i would highly recomend this printer for anyone who is into printing their own photo's
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Good printer, easy to set up wireless printing and decent scanner
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an hp printer from Best Buy because I thought I needed a printer right away, then turned around and bought this printer, which was a step up from the one from Best Buy for $30 less (it's about $70-80 less than the same model at Best Buy). It was very easy to set up and connect it to my network. The scanner works all right, but the print comes back a bit faded.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Works great (for 2 days)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on the strength of reviews here at Amazon. Easy to hook up, found wireless network, and printed everything just fine for 2 days. After that, started getting "Ink Cartridge Failure." Tried everything I could find to fix it, took out ink, replaced it, turned it off, reset it, you name it. After Googling the problem, found out it's pretty common with this printer. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Guarnere

customer_reviews.title: amazing speed in delivery
customer_reviews.text: I received this computer less than 4 days after i ordered it, during the holiday rush! well packaged and my daughter reports that it is wonderful. she did have to buy a plug that works in usa, it appeared to have european prongs. but found a general one that works
customer_reviews.author: san antonio peck

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived promptly, was easy to set up, and produces excellent photos. The original ink cartridges don't last long, however, so buy additional ink.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. Hacker

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on wireless printers. Among the other features I was looking for were double-sided printing capability, scanning and copying (didn't need to fax). Overall, I'm very happy with the printer. The first picture I printed looked great, and printed pages look fine. My only complaint is that it takes a while for a page to print (seems to be at least 30 seconds from the time I press print until I hear the printer printing).
customer_reviews.author: Bill in Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Great All-in-One printer
customer_reviews.text: Great printer right out of the box. Follow easy set up directions and bingo beautiful photo prints and documents and easy two sided printing. Couldn't be more pleased. And Amazon had an amazing price.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Got fax all in one at slightly more than no fax - great value! Replaces printer and fax so room reclaimed on my desktop. Love duplex and ability to print high quality photos! First printer arrived and fax would not feed paper. HP replaced entire unit quickly and courteously! This may be a case of giving away razor too sell blades. Uses ink! Overall extremely pleased with unit!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Wasted my money on junk!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer and it did not work and on unable to return, I received a big 20.00 refund. I will never waste another dime with Amazon, this is the second item in a year that I was unable to return....Beware when you buy, from Amazon.... Read all of the fine print and hope there isn't any reason to return the item....
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Has a few problems
customer_reviews.text: I have had several problems with this printer while printing out photos. The touch pad asks if you want to print more photos while printing out one. I touched the pad that said "more photos" and the screen froze several times. I had to turn it off and put it back on again to start from the beginning. Also, it doesn't print a white border on photos...all are borderless.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy

customer_reviews.title: Printer is fine, 30MB of non-value applications are awful.
customer_reviews.text: This printer is fine, but the 30MB of software HP loads to support the printer adds no value, impacts performance and has even locked up my pc at times. I do not need software to automatically direct me to purchase printer cartridges at retail prices from HP when a cartridge is running low. I find myself having to disable the software from Task Manager. Oh, and the printer works fine without it.
customer_reviews.author: Stratton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly painless setup (very simple touchscreen interface) - I was printing only half an hour after the unit was removed from the box. The picture quality is also fantastic, and it is helpful to have a separate loader for photo paper. Printing speeds were very good, though not as fast as the speeds of comparable laser printers. Elegant, small, sleek design, straightforward wireless setup, Mac/Apple friendly!
customer_reviews.author: C. Rapport

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer!
customer_reviews.text: Many different printing options. Wireless works like a charm. Scanning is automatic to computer. Touchscreen is easy to use. You wont be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: BeckeyJane

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: At 73 I needed help in setting up the printer. I would say it's performance is very good.I would recommend it as a best buy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Hand

customer_reviews.title: It might be my fault
customer_reviews.text: The price is right for this printer, but I have had a lot of problems. I think the problems may be due to user error and not the actual printer. So take my rating with a grain of salt.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for my husband for Christmas. As it turns out, we both ended up connecting wirelessly to this printer, and we both absolutely love the printer. It prints double sided (which he really likes), and the colors are very accurate. Setup was a breeze. We both highly recommend this printer to anyone considering a purchase of a printer.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Seems Good
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a day. The pictures are dazzling and the text good.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: This was a nightmare. I have always been happy buying HP products and printers but this thing was so bad that I purchased a different product this time around. It was noisy, undependable and a piece of junk. I now own a EPSON!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Had to return the printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer came smashed on the corner, and I had to return it. I went to Office Depot and bought another printer. I feared trying to have another sent as our local UPS drivers break items frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Pickles

customer_reviews.title: Regret!  You'll soon feel the fool if you buy this printer!
customer_reviews.text: Had it for months. It can't communicate wirelessly. If you buy this, you will regret it. I am quite proficient in PC and technical matters - this printer is only reliable in the frustration it brings. You were warned.
customer_reviews.author: Swell

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart Premium Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer seems to work well, but the ink goes very fast. We had to replace the black ink cartridge after only a couple of weeks. Other than that, the printer is working very well wirelessly using Windows 7 64 bit on 3 different home computers.
customer_reviews.author: L. Dahl

customer_reviews.title: I am in love
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this little printer. The print quality is good. The paper loads quickly with no redo's required. Switching from print to copy or scan is quick and easy to do. At this price it is a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Iris Black

customer_reviews.title: So far ths machine has been a dream...
customer_reviews.text: From out of the box to wireless operation,everything has been super smooth. No expert required here. Very user friendly and (so far) reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: Initial Set-up
customer_reviews.text: The set-up of this printer was very difficult. For some reason or other it seemed that my computer failed to recognize the connection between printer and computer. After numerous attempts I was finally able to get it set-up and ready for printing. Why all the difficulty I have no idea.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard L. Bland, Jr.

product_meta.title: HP Photosmart Premium All-in-One Printer (CD055A#ABA)
product_meta.description: The HP Photosmart Premium All-in-One Printer comes with built-in wireless printing and wired networking. The two-sided printing saves paper with add-on features like memory card slots and Color LCD Screen. It prints up to 33 pages per minute with a scan resolution up to 4800-dpi optical. You can print up to 2,500 pages per month and the copier is up to 1,250 pages per month. It has a Bluetooth wireless technology and memory card slots, through which you can print photos without using a PC. The color LCD screen helps in editing photos and also manages your printer easily. The auto document feeder helps to fax scan and copy multiple pages automatically.
feature_bullets: Print, scan and copy from a single, energy-efficient device with 3.45-inch touchscreen for printing directly from Snapfish
Connections include Wi-Fi (802.11b/g/n) and Ethernet networking, Bluetooth, USB, and PictBridge
Rotate and crop, adjust brightness, or apply color effects before printing with TouchSmart control panel-no PC necessary
Up to 33 ppm black and 32 ppm color print speeds, Scans up to 4800 x 4800 dpi (8.5 x 11.7 inches)
Borderless photo printing up to 8.5 x 11-inches, 125-sheet input tray and 20-sheet photo tray

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars363 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
